hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Lull Reversal - Intraday Mean Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with low holiday volume, intraday BTC price drops exceeding 1.5% from the previous day's close will revert by at least 0.8% within the next 4 trading hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday periods see reduced institutional participation and ETF flows, creating shallow liquidity pools where retail overreactions are not sustained. Recent news mentions 'holiday lull' and ETF outflows, suggesting this environment. Mean reversion tends to work in low-volatility, neutral regimes without strong directional catalysts.
entry_conditions: BTC price drops > 1.5% from previous day's close (UTC 00:00)
Entry triggered on 15-min candle close below threshold

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.8% of previous day's close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops further to 2.5% below previous day's close

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of signals in a sample of 50 result in hitting the stop-loss before the take-profit or time exit, indicating the drop is part of a new trend, not a temporary overreaction.
